abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column says Kaiser Family Foundation analysis finds more workers have general annual health insurance deductibles, and 2015 average is more than $1,300 for single person; questions and answers provided on managing personal medical costs.
lead_paragraph: Despite gains in the number of Americans with health insurance, employers are continuing to shift costs to workers in the form of higher deductibles.

headline.main: How to Manage Increasingly Higher Medical Deductibles

snippet: Despite gains in the number of Americans with health insurance, employers are continuing to shift costs to workers in the form of higher deductibles.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
